instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.CPUIMVP_VR_ON: What is CPUIMVP_VR_ON? CPUIMVP_VR_ON is a signal that tells the buck converter responsible for PPVCORE_S0_CPU to turn on and create CPU vcore voltage. This comes from ALL_SYS_PWRGD â€“ once ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present, CPUIMVP_VR_ON will be present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green Light, Fan Spin, No chime, No Video
threads.message:
Hello, hope you guys are all right.

So i have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with charger light, fan spin, but no chime and no video (no mouse light). Theres no visible corrosion on the board. And i managed to turn it on once but no luck again. 

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is 0.78v

<CHIP>U7400</CHIP> shows no sign of damage at all, and  <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_VR_ON</SIGNAL> is 3.3v and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> lines are 5v. 

What should i do next?. Could it be a bad CPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green Light, Fan Spin, No chime, No Video
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is 0.78v"
Looks like board is booting.

Did you check both USB ports for activity?
You can try disabling GPU in BIOS, to discard its failure.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green Light, Fan Spin, No chime, No Video
threads.message:
Yes, i checked them both and no light on the mouse. 

The GPU has failed long ago but it worked all right with software bypass. I cant disable it anymore because i cant even boot in safe mode. The LCD shows no image at all. Shouldnt a macbook 2011 still at least try to boot with a bad GPU?

Thank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green Light, Fan Spin, No chime, No Video
threads.message: VCORE starts with 0.78V, or drops from 1.15V after 5-10s?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green Light, Fan Spin, No chime, No Video
threads.message:
I managed to turn it on, i noticed there was a corroded pin on the LCD connector, so i replaced it, and now it chimes and boots.

What i find weird is that there was no chime, no keyboard backlight etc, etc before the LCD connector replacement.
